qa_pairs.question: Who founded Keystone Academy, and which organization is one of its investors according to the source?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Malcolm McKenzie founded Keystone Academy.<cite>[S4]</cite></statement> <statement>Beijing Meilian Wenhua Investment Co., Ltd. is one of its investors.<cite>[S6][S7]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] Keystone Academy


# Keystone Academy



The **Keystone Academy** (北京市鼎石学校; alternatively **Beijing City Dingshi School**) is a private K–12 school in Shunyi, Beijing, China. [S2] It was founded in 2014. [S3] The school offers IB Middle Year Program for Grade 6–10 and IB Diploma Program for Grade 11–12. [S4] Malcolm McKenzie founded Keystone Academy, which opened in 2014. [S5] Beijing Meilian Wenhua Investment Co., Ltd. [S6] (Chinese: 北京美联文华投资有限公司) was one of the school's investors. [S7] According to the school, it employs a curriculum that mimics that of Sidwell Friends School. [S8] The Xinhua News Agency said that Keystone Academy charged more than CN¥200,000 (US$31,008) annually for each student, amounting to "four times the disposable income of an average Beijinger in 2015". [S9] ## Accreditations

Keystone Academy is accredited or a member of the following organizations:

* IB Middle Year Program
* IB Diploma Program
* Round Square, an international network of schools
* Western Association of Schools and Colleges, a K-12 accreditation
* Principals' Training Center for International School
* Association of China and Mongolia International Schools
* International Schools Athletic Conference, a Beijing/Tianjin international schools league. [S10] * East Asia Regional Council of Schools

qa_pairs.question: What is the annual tuition fee at Keystone Academy, and which organization reported this figure?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>The annual tuition fee at Keystone Academy is more than CN¥200,000 (US$31,008) per student, as reported by the Xinhua News Agency.<cite>[S8]</cite></statement>
